To determine the phagocytic ability of microglial cells, we prefer to use apoptotic neural cells as targets, since they should most closely approximate natural microglial targets in vivo.

body: Dissociate neural progenitor cells in 0.1M PBS + 2mg/ml papain \(Worthington) at 37º C for 30 m.

Treat dissociated neural progenitor cells \(NPC) with UV light for 15-20 minutes; NOTE: this should be done in a thin plastic petri dish; thick plastic \(eg. 15 or 50 ml conical tube) will block a significant portion of UV light, leading to suboptimal apoptosis.
Wash NPC in 50 ml conical tube with 40 ml PBS \(RT), spin at 1200 RPM, 7 m, RT, low brake. Decant supernatant.
Resuspend NPC in 5 ml RT 0.1M PBS
Add 5 ul sta 5\(6)-TAMRA, SE \(Invitrogen) to NPC, vortex immediately and let incubate at 37º C in dark for 15 m.
Wash 3X  \(as in Step
Resuspend in 1 ml DMEM/F12 \(Invitrogen) + Anti-anti \(Invitrogen); count cells using a hemacytometer. Dilute or concentrate to 5 X 10<sup>6</sup> per ml.

Feed onto microglial cells \(previously allowed to adhere to glass cover slips in 24-well plates) in 900 ul DMEM/F12 + 10% fetal bovine serum \(Atlanta Biologicals) + Anti-anti at a ratio of 10 NPC:1 microglial cell. NOTE: We typically perform experiments using 5 X 10<sup>4</sup> microglia per coverslip such that cells are spaced sufficiently to allow later quantification, thus 5 X 10<sup>5</sup> NPC would be fed on in 100 ul DMEM/F12 + Anti-anti.
Place cells in incubator, at 37º and 5% CO2
At desired timepoints \(eg. one, two and five

In a sterile hood, remove cover slips with forceps, dip 20 X briskly in warm 0.1M PBS \(to remove non-phagocytosed NPC), then place cover slips in 1 ml 4% PFA in a 24-well plate. Replace remaining cover slips in incubator until next desired time-point.
Fix cells on cover slips in dark for 20 m. Wash 3X with 0.1M PBS, at RT.
Block cover slips in 10% serum in PBS containing 0.3% Triton X-100 and 0.5% BSA, 1 h, RT in dark.
Incubate with anti-CD11b \(eBioscience), 1:100) for 1 h at RT, in dark.
Wash cover slips 3X with 0.1M PBS, RT.
Incubate with desired secondary antibody \(1:1000, Invitrogen) for 1 hour at RT.
Wash cover slips 1X with 0.1M PBS, RT.
Incubate in DAPI \(1:20,000) 5 m.
Wash cover slips 3X with 0.1M PBS, RT.
Mount cover slips with Aqua-Mount \(Lerner Laboratories) on slides. Let dry O/N before imaging.

Typically, a “phagocytic index” can be calculated by dividing the total area of microglial cells \(CD11b+) by the total area of labeled NPC. Alternatively, number of phagocytosed targets/cell may be used to quantify phagocytosis.
To check validity of phagocytosed \(internal) vs. adhered targets, Z-stacks may be imaged on confocal microscope.
